articles.author: Timour Azhari, Muhammad Gebaly
articles.description: Israel and Lebanon exchanged heavy fire into Sunday, with Israeli warplanes carrying out the most intense bombardment in almost a year of war across Lebanon's south, while Hezbollah claimed rocket attacks on military targets in Israel's north.
articles.title: Hezbollah, Israel exchange heavy fire after deadly Israeli strike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel is examining a plan to use siege tactics against Hamas in northern Gaza, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was quoted by several Israeli media outlets as saying on Sunday.
articles.title: Netanyahu examining siege plan for Hamas in north Gaza, Israeli media report

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy has arrived in New York to attend sessions at the U.N. General Assembly, the Ukrinform state news agency reported on Sunday.
articles.title: Zelenskiy arrives in New York for UN meetings, Ukrinform says

articles.author: Simon Jessop, Valerie Volcovici
articles.description: A marathon week of climate change meetings opened in New York on Sunday, with celebrities and world leaders mingling with corporate leaders over talks on how to drive climate action forward.
articles.title: Leaders at climate change meetings in New York warn of growing mistrust between nations

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden is expected to meet Vietnam's President and ruling Communist Party Chief To Lam on Wednesday, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Biden expected to meet Vietnamese president on Wednesday, source says

articles.author: Sarah Marsh
articles.description: The AfD became the first far-right party to win a state election in Germany since World War Two, in Thuringia.
articles.title: Germany's far-right AfD on track for another state election win

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sri Lanka's Marxist-leaning leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake grabbed a commanding early lead on Sunday in his bid to become the next president of the debt-ridden country seeking to elect a leader to bolster its fragile economic recovery.
articles.title: Sri Lanka's Marxist-leaning Dissanayake in early lead to become president

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Republican Donald Trump said that he will not make a fourth consecutive run for the U.S. presidency if he loses the Nov. 5 election, saying "that will be it" in an interview released on Sunday.
articles.title: Trump says he will not run again if he loses in November, 'that will be it'

articles.author: Diego Oré
articles.description: Mexico's ruling Morena party on Sunday elected Interior Secretary Luisa Maria Alcalde as its new leader and awarded the son of outgoing Mexican President Andres Manuel López Obrador a high-ranking position.
articles.title: Mexico's ruling party elects new leader to shape post-Lopez Obrador era

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A gas explosion in a coal mine in Iran's South Khorasan Province killed at least 31 people and injured 16, the country's interior minister Eskandar Momeni told state media on Sunday.
articles.title: At least 31 dead in Iran coal mine blast
